thread.title: Copper Edges Lower on Inventory Rise, Trade Anxiety

author: David Hodari
title: Copper Edges Lower on Inventory Rise, Trade Anxiety
text:
Copper prices inched lower Monday, as traders weighed an increase in London Metal Exchange inventories and trade discussions between the U.S. and China.
Front-month copper for May delivery declined 0.5% to $3.0785 a pound on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have fallen 6.1% this year after hitting a roughly four-year high in late December, hurt by unease over an anticipated economic slowdown in China, the worldâ€™s largest copper consumer, and data showing steady supplies.
